alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Calhoun; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 9:51AM CDT until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Camden affecting Ouachita and Calhoun Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D affecting Bradley, Union and Calhoun Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 79.0 feet, Property in low lying areas needs to be removed. Access roads to oil and gas rigs may be flooded. Levee gates should be closed before the river reaches 80 feet. There is minor flooding at this level. At 80.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs at this level. Levee gates should be closed to prevent the river from backing into Calion Lake. Access to oil and gas rigs and to timber is flooded. There is wide coverage of flooding in the river bottoms. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 78.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Monday evening, May 1st, and rise to a crest of 81.0 feet Thursday morning, May 4th. - Flood stage is 79.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Crest Time Date Ouachita River Thatcher L&D 79.0 78.2 Mon 8 AM 79.3 80.3 81.0 81.0 7 AM 5/04 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
